summary: This bill, introduced in the Senate on September 9, 2025, aims to exempt Medicare from any sequestration cuts triggered by the "One Big Beautiful Bill Act." Specifically, it prevents Medicare programs (Title XVIII of the Social Security Act) from being reduced under Statutory Pay-As-You-Go (PAYGO) rules if the reduction is due to the budgetary impact of the aforementioned act, which passed on July 4, 2025.
